ccre.ctrl

Class BooleanMixing

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.BooleanMixing

  • public class BooleanMixing
extends java.lang.Object
    BooleanMixing is a class that provides a wide variety of useful static methods to accomplish various common actions primarily relating to boolean channels.
    Author:
    skeggsc
    See Also:
    FloatMixing, EventMixing, Mixing

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static BooleanInput alwaysFalse
      A BooleanInput that is always false.
      static BooleanInput alwaysTrue
      A BooleanInput that is always true.
      static BooleanOutput ignoredBooleanOutput
      A BooleanOutput that goes nowhere.
      static BooleanFilter invert
      A BooleanFilter that inverts a value.

    • Field Detail

      • ignoredBooleanOutput

        public static final BooleanOutput ignoredBooleanOutput
        A BooleanOutput that goes nowhere. All data sent here is ignored.

      • alwaysFalse

        public static final BooleanInput alwaysFalse
        A BooleanInput that is always false.

      • invert

        public static final BooleanFilter invert
        A BooleanFilter that inverts a value. (True->False, False->True).

      • alwaysTrue

        public static final BooleanInput alwaysTrue
        A BooleanInput that is always true.

    • Method Detail

      • triggerWhenBooleanChanges

        public static BooleanOutput triggerWhenBooleanChanges(EventOutput toFalse,
                                      EventOutput toTrue)
        Returns a BooleanOutput, and when the value written to it changes, it fires the associated event. This will only fire when the value changes, and is false by default.
        Parameters:
        toFalse - if the output becomes false.
        toTrue - if the output becomes true.
        Returns:
        the output that can trigger the events.

      • combine

        public static BooleanOutput combine(BooleanOutput a,
                    BooleanOutput b)
        Combine two BooleanOutputs so that any write to the returned output will go to both of the specified outputs.
        Parameters:
        a - the first output
        b - the second output
        Returns:
        the output that will write to both specified outputs.

      • combine

        public static BooleanOutput combine(BooleanOutput a,
                    BooleanOutput b,
                    BooleanOutput c)
        Combine three BooleanOutputs so that any write to the returned output will go to all of the specified outputs.
        Parameters:
        a - the first output
        b - the second output
        c - the third output
        Returns:
        the output that will write to all specified outputs.

      • invert

        public static BooleanInputPoll invert(BooleanInputPoll value)
        Returns a BooleanInputPoll that represents the logical inversion of the value of the specified input.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to invert.
        Returns:
        the inverted value.

      • invert

        public static BooleanInput invert(BooleanInput value)
        Returns a BooleanInput that represents the logical inversion of the value of the specified input.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to invert.
        Returns:
        the inverted value.

      • invert

        public static BooleanOutput invert(BooleanOutput output)
        Returns a BooleanOutput that, when written to, writes the logical inversion of the value through to the specified output.
        Parameters:
        output - the output to write inverted values to.
        Returns:
        the output to write pre-inverted values to.

      • xorBooleans

        public static BooleanInputPoll xorBooleans(BooleanInputPoll a,
                           BooleanInputPoll b)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when either specified input is true, but not both.
        Parameters:
        a - the first input.
        b - the second input.
        Returns:
        the input representing if either of the given inputs is true, but not both.

      • orBooleans

        public static BooleanInputPoll orBooleans(BooleanInputPoll a,
                          BooleanInputPoll b)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when either specified input is true.
        Parameters:
        a - the first input.
        b - the second input.
        Returns:
        the input representing if either of the given inputs is true.

      • orBooleans

        public static BooleanInputPoll orBooleans(BooleanInputPoll... vals)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when any specified input is true.
        Parameters:
        vals - the inputs to check.
        Returns:
        the input representing if any given input is true.

      • whenBooleanBecomes

        public static EventInput whenBooleanBecomes(BooleanInputPoll input,
                            boolean target,
                            EventInput checkTrigger)
        When the checkTrigger event is fired, check if the specified input has changed to the target value since the last check. If it has, then the returned EventInput is fired.
        Parameters:
        input - the value to check.
        target - the target value to trigger the event.
        checkTrigger - when to check for changes.
        Returns:
        the EventInput that is fired when the input becomes the target.

      • whenBooleanBecomes

        public static EventInput whenBooleanBecomes(BooleanInput input,
                            boolean target)
        Returns an EventInput that fires when the input changes to the target value.
        Parameters:
        input - the value to check.
        target - the target value to trigger the event.
        Returns:
        the EventInput that is fired when the input becomes the target.

      • pumpWhen

        public static void pumpWhen(EventInput trigger,
            BooleanInputPoll in,
            BooleanOutput out)
        When the specified event is fired, pump the value from the specified input to the specified output.
        Parameters:
        trigger - when to pump the value
        in - the input
        out - the output

      • getSetEvent

        public static EventOutput getSetEvent(BooleanOutput output,
                      boolean value)
        Returns an EventOutput that, when fired, writes the specified value to the specified output.
        Parameters:
        output - the output to write to.
        value - the value to write.
        Returns:
        the event to write the value.

      • pumpEvent

        public static EventOutput pumpEvent(BooleanInputPoll in,
                    BooleanOutput out)
        Returns an EventOutput that, when called, pumps the value from the specified input to the specified output
        Parameters:
        in - the input
        out - the output
        Returns:
        the EventOutput that pumps the value

      • createDispatch

        public static BooleanInput createDispatch(BooleanInputPoll input,
                          EventInput trigger)
        Return a BooleanInput that is the same as the specified BooleanInputPoll, except that it is also a producer that will update whenever the specified event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        input - the original input.
        trigger - the event to dispatch at.
        Returns:
        the dispatchable input.

      • andBooleans

        public static BooleanInputPoll andBooleans(BooleanInputPoll a,
                           BooleanInputPoll b)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when both specified inputs are true.
        Parameters:
        a - the first input.
        b - the second input.
        Returns:
        the input representing if both given inputs are true.

        public static BooleanInputPoll andBooleans(BooleanInputPoll... vals)
        Return a BooleanInputPoll that is true when all specified inputs are true.
        Parameters:
        vals - the inputs to check.
        Returns:
        the input representing if all given inputs are true.

      • setWhen

        public static void setWhen(EventInput when,
           BooleanOutput out,
           boolean value)
        When the specified EventInput is fired, write the specified value to the specified output
        Parameters:
        when - when to write the value.
        out - the output to write to.
        value - the value to write.
